result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Maurice Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work and school.  May be served in Milwaukee County, but not on electronic monitoring.  Credit for time served to be applied only in the event of revocation.  DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

records.addlTxt:
Court Reporter Leslie Johnson. Defendant Curtis Maurice Stewart in court with attorney Kaitlin A Lamb.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on post-conviction motions/Machner hearing

Per Atty Lamb, no reasonable suspicion to prolong stop.
Per Atty Johnson - reasonable suspicion to extend stop.
BTC:  Officer had no doubt that he smelt THC.  Patdown was reasonable for safety.   No merit to first point.

Per Atty Lamb, police violated rights by unlawfully searching vehicle.
Per Atty Johnson, smelling burnt THC is enough to justify searching vehicle.
BTC:  Officer was entitled to sesarch entire vehicle.

Per Atty Lamb, rights violated when dog entered vehicle and issue with who opened the door.
Per Atty Johnson, odor of burnt THC and canine alerted before entering vehicle.
BTC:  No case law as to whether door needs to be open or closed.  Officer knew alert signals by dog and did not open the door.  No violation of defendant's constitutional rights on any point.

Atty Lamb calls Carolyn Delery - DSAT - defendant's former attorney
Cross by Atty Johnson.  

No further witnesses for the Plaintiff
No witnesses for the State.

Argument by Atty Lamb.  
Argument by Atty Johnson.
Rebuttal by Atty Lamb.
BTC:  Atty Delery was effective counsel during this case.  No deficiency by Atty Delery.  Motions denied.  Atty Lamb to submit the order.
State's Brief in Response to Def's Mt for Postconviction Relief

Racine County Pretrial Screening Report
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
